Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2012 03:34AM alice71053 wrote: Had my second round of Halaven last tuesday. This has been my week off but can't seem to shake this fatigue. Not sure if this is normal for it to drag out so long or not but again nothing has been normal for me.  Just wondering if I was alone with this or not....and, with the hair issue wondered when to expect the fallout....it bald thing doesn't bother me just like to have an idea of when to expect it... I'm the first Halaven patient my Onc has had....  Thanks for any input at all....{HUGS}
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2012 11:16AM alice71053 wrote: HI LADIES.....WELL STARTED DAY ONE OF HALAVEN YESTERDAY.....ONC INFORMED ME PROBABLY NO SE FOR A COUPLE DAYS.....GO FOR SECOND TREATMENT NEXT WEEK IF LABS ARE GOOD.....IT'S BEEN GREAT COMING ON HERE AND SEEING HOW EVERYONE ELSE IS DOING....THANKS FOR ALL THE POSTS!
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2011 06:19PM alice71053 wrote:  I totally know how you feel....I get told all the time, you don't look or act sick. And if you'ld lose some weight you'ld feel alot better. I guess because I'm not a walking skeleton it's not a serious issue. I love it when people who have never been down this road say they know how you feel. Well, I wouldn't wish this on anyone but till  you walk in our shoes you don't know how I feel...Sorry to sound so negative, just letting off steam...HUGS TO ALL
Posts.Title: Don't Sweet the Small Stuff Fitztwins Fitztwins

Posts.Content: alice71053 wrote: Hi Everyone, Just returned from Onc visit...Had 3 month Bone Scan and Ct Scan done...Got halfway descent results, Bone Mets stable, Liver Mets some better and some worse and Lymph alittle larger...but overall pretty good I guess with what dealt....Been on Halaven for 6 months now but Onc says cancer has built up a resistance to it so going to try something else.....Xeloda...just wondering what to expect from this drug, she gave me a print out of info on it but just wondering how it effected others....any feedback would be much appreciated....Hope and Positive Thoughts to all !!!!! Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2012 07:35PM alice71053 wrote: Hi Peggy, I'm also on Halaven.....I've had few side effects from it but also have extreme fatigue from it.  For me it lasts about 2 days, have treatment on tuesday and fatigue sets in usually thursday and lasts a couple days.  Didn't realize a person could sleep this much.  Not really sure what can be done for it. Positive thoughts coming your way...{HUGS}
Posts.Title: HELP! My Mother is a Zombie! sincitydealer 3katz

Posts.Content: alice71053 wrote: JUST WONDERING IF ANYONE ELSE OUT THERE ON HALAVEN?  THIS IS ANOTHER NEW CHEMO FOR ME AND ALWAYS GET ALITTLE NERVOUS ABOUT STARTING A NEW ONE.....ONC DR. SAID AFTER BEING ON GEMZAR/CARBO COMBINATION FOR 10 MONTHS THE CANCER WAS BUILDING UP A RESISTANCE TO IT SO NOW ONTO THIS.....BEEN ON SO MANY DIFFERENT CHEMOS AND MEDS IT'S HARD TO KEEP TRACK.....BUT STAYING POSITIVE THAT ONE DAY IT WILL GO INTO REMISSION.....THANKS FOR ALL YOUR INPUT AND SUPPORT....I HOPE EVERYONE HAS A BLESSED AND MERRY CHRISTMAS!!!!
